features: Pirate Adventure: The YBLOCK mini particle pirate ship model comprises 1328Pcs easy-to-assemble components. (TIPS: this building set is mini size, it's NOT COMPATIBLE with other WELL-KNOWN BRAND)

Realistic Detail: Embark on thrilling escapades as you navigate the ship through a realm of daring exploits. This miniature vessel boasts a menacing skull and crossbones flag, adjustable cannons, realistic masts, a functioning helm, and windows that unveil concealed treasures. The triumphant pirate flag will proudly wave in the breeze, signaling victory in every adventure.
Display Size: This eye-catching model looked amazing when it was on display. Its dimensions are designed to be real models. The size of mini particle pirate ship is 12.0*3.35*8.55inches.

High Quality: This prirate ship building kits is made from high-quality plastic, ensuring that it's sturdy and long-lasting. It's a great investment for parents who want to encourage their child's creativity and imagination while also providing a fun and engaging toy.

Great Gift: This pirate ship building kit seamlessly blends learning with fun, making it an ideal gift for boys and girls aged 8 and above. perfect for birthdays, and Christmas. As they assemble this ship toy and explore its intricate features, they are building not just a vessel but also their lifelong dreams.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect gift for my nephew
reviews.reviewText: My nephew loves pirate movies, and now he can build this pirate ship and pretend his own pirate adventures. His mom is going to buy the little people to go with it for Christmas, I got the biggest thank you hug ever from him at his birthday party.

reviews.reviewerName: Jason and Mary ThompsonJason and Mary Thompson
reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sails were the hardest to install
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. This was a fun build that took about 4 hours of relaxed building time to complete. There were a few frustrations, mostly dealing with the sails and the main mast.The main mast has a spot where the crow's nest connects to the mast piece and it just doesn't want to stay together when installing the sails onto the piece. This was made more complex because I mistakenly grabbed the top sail instead of the bottom one to install on the bottom crossbar, but it still gave me trouble even when I fixed my mistake. The two sails don't rest far enough apart from each other to make the installation easy, as they sort of push and pull on each other.The back sail was confusing because the picture in the book shows it in the opposite direction of how it should be installed and I finally had a random thought flash through my mind at the end of the build about switching it from upside down to right side up (upside down, it covers a lot of the captain's wheel, which is what triggered my thought of switching it).The front sail was actually the easiest, maybe in part to being the last one installed, but had one tricky part--the cord that is strung from the front of the ship to the back is fastened by being pinched between a peg and its hole. The front was easy enough, but the back was between a hole and a smaller "peg" that's also the end of a chain. I simply tied the string in the back to get it to hold instead of trying to get it successfully pinched in.The fun surprise is figuring out that the cannons actually fired, although very weakly. They do fire a little better when they're being held down and can't move as easily as in my video, but it's still a maximum range of 12-18 inches.Overall, I did enjoy this build. It was relaxing and fun, except for those stubborn sails. I'm glad I got it to add to my collection.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not Lego, but tries
reviews.reviewText: First off, not being compatible with Lego sucks. If you aren't going for a mini set, there is no reason to not make things cross compatible. This gets a ding just for that, because any child or adult you gift it to is ultimately going to be disappointed.However, the box it comes in is very Lego-like. The instructions are bright, colourful, and some of the better third-party instructions I've seen. They come as a large booklet. However, the packaging isn't perfect, the booklet came pretty bent, and the stickers came almost unusable, thrown in loose and banged around until they were actually coming off the backing when I opened the box, and do not lay flat. Not ideal.The pieces themselves are ok. They are packaged in the standard numbered bags. The base pieces are quite sturdy.I'd have second thoughts about giving this as a gift. It is alright for a knock-off Lego set that is not-quite Pirates of the Caribbean, and an authentic set is going to be quite expensive, so it has that going for it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Cool pirate Lego ship
reviews.reviewText: This Pirates Ship Building Mini Blocks Set is a great gift for kids and adult collections enthusiasts. It contains 1328 pieces and is not compatible with Lego sets. The set includes a pirate ship with intricate details such as pirate flags, pirate arsenal, artillery, cabin, and much more. The set is made from high-quality materials, ensuring that it’s sturdy and long-lasting. It will test your patience and hands-on skills as you construct the ship from scratch, piece by piece. It’s the perfect way to train your focus and attention to detail, all while having a blast! This is a challenging build so be prepared to spend some time on this one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Coolest pirate ship kit!
reviews.reviewText: I can't wait to start putting this kit together with my kids! They love pirates, and so do I, and this is an awesome pirate ship! The box is hefty and there are tons of pieces in it (621). The pieces, though not Lego-branded or compatible, are very similar in shape and size, and appear to be of equivalent quality. All the pieces are in numbered bags to keep them organized. The instruction manual is detailed and very clear. And if the kids don't want to do it, I will do it by myself because it is so cool!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great building block ship, includes great figures to complete the design!
reviews.reviewText: It doesn't really say anywhere on the box or ad, so try to guess what franchise they based this set on! They did a really good job, too, from the expressive characters to the creative detailing and set of the ship itself. It ends up being larger than you'd expect, and stands up to play quite well! The only thing missing is some of those smooth round pieces for the bottom (so it can "glide" along hard surfaces). Beyond that, they nailed all the details. Easy to follow instructions as well! Highly recommended!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars great build. not compatible with legos
reviews.reviewText: This was a fun build. Sturdy. Took some time but that's what I wanted to do. Be occupied. The ship looks great.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2023
reviews.reviewText: my son loves legos, but its more he love for me to put them together and then he gets to play with the after product. if you have the time then yeah this is a great lego to get. seriously this took like 5 hours to put together. yeah i offically hate legos. but ill still do it for my son.
